subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: It's white?
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Yeah, I know a Johnny I haven't talked to in like 6-8 years.

 F-S

On Wed, Jun 9, 2010 at 3:30 PM, tim_woolworth <tim@...> wrote:

>
>
> Frank,
>
> I do not hear the crossing over line you heard. Instead, this appears to be
> a lengthy conversation. I am particularly fond of this clip because it is an
> excellent example of how individual words are selectively used by the others
> to create long sentences of communication. This entire clip is one
> conversation that is cut off at the end. Do you know a Johnny?
>
> What I hear:
>
> @.01 - .05: This is getting a little old for Johnny (male)
> @.05: Yeah (male)
> @.06: What! (male)
> @.07: Uh oh. (male)
> @.08: We (male)
> @.09: Never (male)
> @.09 - .10: Feel the thing is that (male)
> @.11: Wasting our time (female)
> @.12: What? (electronic)
> @.13 - .14: You (?pick up? make them?) sleep
> @.15: the word is cut off.
>
> Tim
>
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> >
> > A battery powered AM/FM clock radio, using the same sweep board I made
> for
> > the RS radio. At 11-12 seconds "Afraid to cross over". Hummmm, white
> box!?
> >
> > Frank-S
> >
>
>  
>

Yeah, I know a Johnny I ha en' alked o in like 6-8 yea s.
 
 F-S
